http //instagram com/getyerhookon @getyerhookon #getyerhookon © getyerhookon page 2 mosaic crochet technique if you are new to mosaic crochet please take the time to read through the mosaic crochet technique guide and how to read a mosaic chart every row is worked with one colour fasten and snip the yarn after each row always work on the front side only mosaic crochet does not require you to turn your work start the next row from the right-hand side on every row a blank box means you will work a single_crochet single_crochet in the back loop of the stitch in the row below a box with an x means you will work a double_crochet double_crochet in the front loop of the stitch two row below chart are read from right to left unless you are lefthanded therefore you can read them from left to right how to read a mosaic chart mosaic charts can be a little confusing when you first look at them but they re simple to read once you understand what you re looking at on the chart below the pattern of green and white boxes you see is how it will turn out once it has been crocheted you don t change colours halfway through the row to create the pattern when reading a chart you start at the bottom right of the chart and work all the way across to the left of the chart as shown below you use one colour per row all the way along fastening off at the end of the row and starting the next row again from the right-hand side where you see an x you double_crochet into the front notes loop of the stitch two row below these charts are just an example and don t relate to the patterns within this pdf © getyerhookon page 3 chart legend x double_crochet in front loop of the stitch two row below single_crochet in back loop of the stitch in the current row a work with colour a
